title: MD, DPhil
biography: Siddhartha Mukherjee (born 1970) is an Indian-born American physician, biologist, oncologist, and Pulitzer Prize-winning author. He serves as Associate Professor of Medicine at Columbia University and practices as an oncologist at the university's medical center, specializing in the biology of normal and malignant blood development. Born in New Delhi, he earned degrees from Stanford University (BS in Biology), the University of Oxford as a Rhodes Scholar (DPhil in Immunology), and Harvard Medical School (MD). His book 'The Emperor of All Maladies: A Biography of Cancer' won the 2011 Pulitzer Prize for General Nonfiction and was named one of Time magazine's All-Time 100 Nonfiction Books. He has also authored 'The Gene: An Intimate History' (2016) and 'The Song of the Cell' (2022). His scientific research appears in Nature, Cell, and the New England Journal of Medicine.

citations.title: Clonal Evolution of Pre-Leukemic Hematopoietic Stem Cells Precedes Human Acute Myeloid Leukemia
